SetCurrentDialog(Dialog)

Set the current dialog. This dialog should be either the previous or next dialog from the last one, and the player must be in a dialog.

Declaration
public bool SetCurrentDialog(Dialog currentDialog)

Type Name Description
Dialog currentDialog

The dialog that is now current.

| Improve this Doc View Source

SetDialogIndex(VisibleObject, Int32, Int32)

Set the index of a current dialog session. This dialog should be either the previous or next dialog from the last one (index wise) and the player must be in a dialog.

Declaration
public bool SetDialogIndex(VisibleObject target, int pursuitId, int newIndex)
Parameters
Type Name Description
VisibleObject target

The target merchant.
System.Int32 pursuitId

A dialog sequence (pursuit) ID.
System.Int32 newIndex

The index to which we are navigating.

TransitionDialog(VisibleObject, DialogSequence)

Transition between two dialog sequences. This allows us to start a new sequence from an option or a response handler, and validate where we've come from.

Declaration
public bool TransitionDialog(VisibleObject target, DialogSequence dialogStart)
Parameters
Type Name Description
VisibleObject target

A VisibleObject that is the target of the dialog sequence
DialogSequence dialogStart

The dialog sequence to which we will transition.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean
